featured.text: On his first trip to Europe, why did Camake think the audience might fall asleep? (A)
According to this passage, which of the following statements is true? (A) Scary lullabies better help babies fall asleep. (B) Mothers prefer to sing lullabies with a joyful melody.
He was worried that the audience would fall asleep since most of the 75-minute performance was a cappella, that is, singing without instrumental sound.

definition.zh_def: 睡著的，處於睡眠狀態的。
definition.en_def: In a state of sleep; not awake.
definition.example: The baby is sound asleep in her crib.
